Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with trace of added white band near top of sherd; exterior: part of a lion’s head, mane and raised foreleg, to left.
Curator's comments: Lions on Simple Animal Style vases are usually facing right.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 287, no. 838, pl. 117)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1051) (phase 2)
